title: Exercises: Trimester Review & Final Project Proposal

items.title: Exercise 1: Proposal Executive Summary (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A — Executive Summary: Automated Vendor Vetting System

Introduction: This proposal outlines a project to streamline our current vendor vetting process, which has become a significant bottleneck in our operations. If we had automated this last quarter, we wouldn't be facing the current backlog of approvals (Mixed Conditional).

Solution: We propose to implement 'VetScan', a software tool that will be monitoring vendor compliance in real-time (Future Continuous). By the end of Q1, we will have integrated all existing vendor data into the new system (Future Perfect).

Risk Assessment: The primary risk is staff resistance to the new workflow. Our mitigation strategy involves holding three training workshops. Under no circumstances should the legacy system be deactivated before the new data is fully reconciled.

KPI: 50% reduction in approval time.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of the 'VetScan' project?
options: To streamline the vendor vetting process and reduce bottlenecks.
To deactivate the legacy system immediately.
questions.explanation: Doc A states the proposal outlines a project to 'streamline our current vendor vetting process'.

questions.question: By when does the proposal expect all vendor data to be integrated?
options: By the end of this week.
By the middle of next month.
questions.explanation: Doc A mentions: 'By the end of Q1, we will have integrated all existing vendor data'.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: Proposal Structure. Which section provides a 'high-level overview of the proposed change'?
items.explanation: The Executive Summary is a high-level overview of the entire proposal.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Grammar Synthesis. When analyzing a past failure using 'If + Past Perfect, would have + past participle', which conditional are you using?
items.explanation: The Third Conditional is used to analyze hypothetical past events.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Review Vocabulary. Complete the sentence: 'This week we will ___ our learning to demonstrate our ___ in administrative tasks.'
items.explanation: To 'synthesise' learning is to combine it to show 'competency' (ability).

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Mixed Conditionals Review. Form a sentence linking a past action to a present result (e.g., 'not hire the consultant' / 'be in trouble now').
items.modelAnswer: If we had hired the consultant, we wouldn't be in trouble now.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: Future Tenses Review. Describe your work status for next Friday at 3 PM using both Future Continuous and Future Perfect (e.g., 'working on the pitch' / 'finish the slides').
items.modelAnswer: At 3 PM next Friday, I will be working on the pitch, and by 5 PM, I will have finished the slides.

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Action Points. Based on Doc A, list the 2 main sections of the proposal and one specific task mentioned in each.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Solution: Implement 'VetScan' software. 2. Risk Assessment: Hold three training workshops.

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. Which is the most professional way to ask for a final review of your project proposal?
options: Could you please review my final project proposal? I’m aiming to submit the final version by Friday EOD and would value your feedback.
I've finished the proposal. When will you read it?
Final project attached. Tell me what's wrong.
items.explanation: This option is polite, sets a clear timeframe, and uses professional language.

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Submission Email. Write a 50-word email submitting your final project. Use a relative clause to describe the proposal.
items.modelAnswer: Dear Sarah, please find attached my final project proposal, which focuses on streamlining our procurement workflow. I believe the solution I have proposed will mitigate our current risk of delays. I look forward to your feedback. Best regards, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: Operational Logic. Matching trimester concepts: Which term refers to 'the uncontrolled expansion of a project'?
items.explanation: Scope creep refers to the uncontrolled expansion of project requirements.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Pitch Prep. Prepare a script for a 5-minute pitch of your 'VetScan' proposal (Doc A). You must cover: The bottleneck, the solution, a risk, and a milestone using the Future Perfect.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Comprehensive coverage, Synthesised vocabulary, Persuasive delivery.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Reflection. Record a 2-minute audio reflecting on your growth this trimester. Mention one administrative skill you have improved and one grammatical structure you find most useful for your work.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Self-evaluation, Use of B2 level vocabulary, Fluency.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Final Project Proposal (Portfolio). Write a 300-word proposal to improve 'Office Meeting Efficiency'. Use: Executive Summary, Current Situation, Solution (with Future Tenses), and Risk Assessment (with Conditionals).
items.modelAnswer:
Executive Summary: This proposal aims to streamline our internal meetings by introducing 'Lean Agendas'. 

Current Situation: We currently spend 10 hours per week in meetings, many of which lack clear action items. This has become a bottleneck for our core operations.

Proposed Solution: Next month, we will be implementing a 15-minute standing meeting policy. By the end of the month, we will have reduced our total meeting time by 30%. 

Risk Assessment: If we hadn't experienced so much fatigue from long meetings, there wouldn't be such a strong case for this change now. If a meeting were to overrun, the chair would have to adjourn it immediately. 

We believe this pivot will lead to greater accountability and efficiency across the team.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: Skill Matrix. Complete a table for 3 skills you learned this trimester. Format: Skill | Confidence (1-10) | Example of use.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Minute-Taking | 9 | Wrote minutes for the Q3 review. 2. Risk Management | 8 | Created a risk register for the BBQ. 3. Managing Up | 7 | Proposed a solution to my boss.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Trimester Mini-test. 1) Define 'Scope Creep'. 2) Give an example of a Third Conditional. 3) What is the difference between a defining and non-defining relative clause? 4) List 4 project phases.
items.modelAnswer: 1) Uncontrolled expansion of project requirements. 2) If I had known, I would have helped. 3) Defining is essential (no commas); Non-defining is extra info (commas). 4) Initiation, Planning, Execution, Closure.

items.prompt: Exercise 16: Future Perfect vs Continuous. By this time next week, we ___ the final project review.
items.explanation: Future Perfect is used for completion by a certain time.

items.prompt: Exercise 17: Modals of Deduction. There's no way Sarah missed the meeting; she's the chair. She ___ been there.
items.explanation: 'Must have' indicates high certainty about a past event.

items.prompt: Exercise 18: Vocabulary Review. To 'delegate' a task means to:
items.explanation: Delegation is the act of assigning responsibility to others.

items.prompt: Exercise 19: Relative Clauses. Choose the correct relative pronoun: 'The office ___ we work is being renovated.'
items.explanation: 'Where' is used for places.

items.prompt: Exercise 20: Third Conditional. If the administrator ___ the budget, the project wouldn't have run over cost.
items.explanation: Third Conditional uses 'If + Past Perfect'.

items.prompt: Exercise 21: Risk Response. Installing a fire alarm is an example of:
items.explanation: Mitigation reduces the probability or impact of a risk.

items.prompt: Exercise 22: Change Management. A 'Key Player' is someone who has:
items.explanation: According to the Mendelow Matrix, Key Players have high power and high interest.

items.prompt: Exercise 23: Mixed Conditionals. If he ___ the email yesterday, he wouldn't be so confused now.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional: Past action (had read) affects present state (wouldn't be).

items.prompt: Exercise 24: Business Continuity. RTO refers to:
items.explanation: RTO is the targeted duration to restore a process.

items.title: Exercise 25: Oral Recording Task 1 - Proposal Pitch
items.prompt: You are presenting your final project proposal. Record a 60-second pitch. Mention: 1) The 'bottleneck' you are addressing, 2) The 'deliverables' of your project, and 3) A 'milestone' you will have achieved by next month.
items.modelAnswer: Good morning. My proposal addresses the significant bottleneck in our current onboarding process, which is causing a two-week delay for new hires. The key deliverables include a digital asset provisioning portal and a revised SOP manual. By next month, we will have achieved our first milestone: the completion of the pilot testing phase.

items.title: Exercise 26: Final Project Feedback
items.prompt: Listen to a manager providing feedback on a project proposal.

questions.question: What does the manager like about the 'Executive Summary'?
options: It is concise and clearly identifies the bottleneck.
questions.explanation: The manager praises the clarity and conciseness of the summary.

questions.question: What is the manager's concern regarding the 'Risk Assessment'?
options: The mitigation plan is too expensive.
questions.explanation: The manager mentions that the proposed 30-minute RTO might be too ambitious.

items.prompt: Exercise 27: Conflict Resolution. When you 'placate' someone, you are:
options: Calming them down or making them less hostile
items.explanation: To placate is to soothe or appease.

items.prompt: Exercise 28: SOPs. What does SOP stand for?
items.explanation: SOP stands for Standard Operating Procedure.

items.title: Exercise 29: Dictation
items.prompt: Listen and type the sentence about project closure.
items.answer: By the end of the closure phase, we will have reconciled all the project accounts and archived the documentation.
items.explanation: Focus on the future perfect 'will have reconciled'.

items.title: Exercise 30: Gap-fill - Proposal Review
items.prompt: Listen and fill in the missing professional terms.
items.text: The **{executive summary}** was well-written, but the **{stakeholder analysis}** was a bit thin. You need to identify the **{key players}** more clearly. If you **{had used}** the Mendelow Matrix, you **{would have identified}** the Finance Director as a high-power individual.
items.explanation: Uses third conditional and project proposal terminology.

items.title: Exercise 31: Proposal Guidelines (Doc C)
items.text:
Doc C — Internal Memo: Drafting Your Final Project Proposal

To ensure your proposal is successful, you must follow the standard trimester **synthesis** guidelines. Every proposal must begin with an **Executive Summary** that is both **data-driven** and **persuasive**. You should map your **stakeholders** using the matrix we covered in Week 9. Ensure your **Risk Assessment** includes both **mitigation** and **contingency** plans. If we **had followed** these standards last year, our project **resilience** would be much higher today. By the end of this week, all students **will be submitting** their final drafts for peer review. Those **who** successfully pass the review will move to the presentation phase.

### Formatting Requirements
1. **Executive Summary**: Max 250 words.
2. **Grammar**: Must include at least one conditional and one complex future tense.
3. **Visuals**: Include one Gantt Chart or Risk Matrix.

questions.question: What is the first requirement for a successful proposal according to Doc C?
options: An Executive Summary that is data-driven and persuasive.
A list of every employee in the company.
questions.explanation: The memo states every proposal must begin with an Executive Summary that is data-driven and persuasive.

questions.question: Which matrix should be used for mapping stakeholders?
questions.explanation: The text refers to the matrix covered in Week 9, which is the Mendelow Matrix.

questions.question: What will students be doing by the end of the week?
options: Submitting their final drafts for peer review.
questions.explanation: The memo states: 'By the end of this week, all students will be submitting their final drafts'.

items.prompt: Exercise 32: Phrasal Verbs. We need to ___ the root cause of the delay.
items.explanation: To 'get to the root cause' means to discover the fundamental reason.

items.prompt: Exercise 33: Onboarding. 'Asset Provisioning' involves:
options: Giving new employees the equipment and access they need
items.explanation: Asset provisioning is the process of providing equipment/access to staff.

items.prompt: Exercise 34: Future Perfect. I hope I ___ my English goals by December.
items.explanation: Future Perfect for a completed action by a future point.

items.prompt: Exercise 35: Third Conditional. If you ___ me about the bottleneck, I could have helped you.
items.explanation: Third conditional 'if' clause uses Past Perfect.

items.prompt: Exercise 36: Project Summary. Summarize the 'Alpha Project' (from previous weeks) in 3 sentences using one relative clause and one future tense.
items.modelAnswer: The Alpha Project, which was our main focus last month, is now in the closure phase. We faced several bottlenecks, but we successfully mitigated them. By next Monday, we will have archived all relevant data.

items.prompt: Exercise 37: Trimester Reflection. Write 3 things you learned about 'Risk Management' this trimester.
items.modelAnswer: 1. How to use a Risk Matrix (Probability/Impact). 2. The difference between Mitigation and Contingency. 3. How to define RTO and RPO.

items.prompt: Exercise 38: Inversion. Choose the correct inverted structure: 'I have never seen such a mess.'
options: Never I have seen such a mess.
Never have I seen such a mess.
I have never seen such a mess.
Seen never I have such a mess.
items.explanation: Inversion for emphasis: Never + auxiliary + subject + verb.

items.prompt: Exercise 39: Change Management. 'Buy-in' means:
options: Agreement or support for a proposed plan
items.explanation: 'Buy-in' is the acceptance of and commitment to a specific concept or change.

items.title: Exercise 40: Oral Recording Task 2 - Trimester Reflection
items.prompt: Record a 60-second reflection on your progress this trimester. Mention: 1) One 'competency' you have mastered, 2) A grammar structure you find useful for 'forecasting', and 3) How your 'professional persona' has evolved.
items.modelAnswer: This trimester, I have mastered the competency of stakeholder management using the Mendelow Matrix. I find the Future Perfect tense particularly useful for forecasting deadlines and commitments. My professional persona has evolved to be more confident and precise, especially when dealing with complex administrative scenarios in English.

items.prompt: Exercise 41: Mixed Conditional Practice. 'not lose my passport (past) / be at the meeting now (present)'.
items.modelAnswer: If I hadn't lost my passport, I would be at the meeting now.

items.prompt: Exercise 42: Future Continuous Practice. 'this time tomorrow / fly to London'.
items.modelAnswer: This time tomorrow, I will be flying to London.

items.prompt: Exercise 43: Vocabulary in context. Write a sentence using 'Escalation'.
items.modelAnswer: If the issue cannot be resolved by the team leader, we will initiate the escalation protocol.

items.prompt: Exercise 44: Error Correction. Fix: 'I will have finish the report by 5.'
items.modelAnswer: I will have finished the report by 5.

items.title: Exercise 45: Trimester Synthesis Review
items.prompt: Synthesize the entire trimester's learning: 1) List the 4 phases of the project lifecycle. 2) Write a sentence about a past mistake using a third conditional. 3) Explain how 'Asset Provisioning' and 'Business Continuity' are linked in administrative management.
items.modelAnswer: 1) The four phases are Initiation, Planning, Execution, and Closure. 2) If we had performed a more thorough feasibility study, the project wouldn't have run over budget. 3) Asset provisioning ensures new employees have the necessary tools to work, while business continuity ensures those tools and systems remain available or are restored quickly during a crisis, both being vital for operational stability.

items.prompt: Exercise 46: The Pitch. What is the main purpose of a 'Hook' in an elevator pitch?
options: To provide a detailed budget breakdown
To grab the listener's attention immediately
To list all project team members
To explain the legal fine print
items.explanation: A hook is designed to capture attention by highlighting a significant fact or pain point.

items.prompt: Exercise 47: The Pitch. Which sentence focuses on 'Benefit over Feature'?
options: The system runs on a cloud server.
Implementing this will save the HR team 20 hours of manual data entry per week.
The interface is colored blue and white.
items.explanation: Saving 20 hours per week is a benefit; the others are just technical features.

items.prompt: Exercise 48: Pitching. Write a 'Hook' for a proposal to automate office supply ordering based on a 10% waste statistic.
items.modelAnswer: Did you know that 10% of our office supplies are currently wasted due to over-ordering?

items.prompt: Exercise 49: Call to Action. Which is the most effective 'Call to Action' for a pitch?
options: I hope you liked the idea.
Could we schedule a 10-minute follow-up on Tuesday to discuss the pilot phase?
Tell me if you need anything else.
items.explanation: A strong CTA is specific and suggests a concrete next step.

items.prompt: Exercise 50: Persuasive Language. Rewrite this feature as a benefit: 'The new system has an automated backup feature.'
items.modelAnswer: The automated backup feature ensures our data is always protected, eliminating the risk of manual error and data loss.

items.prompt: Exercise 51: Financial Justification. What does ROI stand for?
items.explanation: ROI (Return on Investment) measures the gain relative to the cost of an investment.

items.prompt: Exercise 52: Finance. Which term refers to 'recurring, day-to-day costs'?
items.explanation: OpEx covers the ongoing costs of running a business or system.

items.prompt: Exercise 53: Financial Logic. Explain the 'Opportunity Cost' of not upgrading an old server that crashes twice a week.
items.modelAnswer: The opportunity cost includes the lost productivity of the staff during downtime and the potential loss of revenue while systems are offline.

items.prompt: Exercise 54: AI Integration. Which task is most suitable for AI automation in an administrative context?
options: Resolving complex HR disputes between senior executives
Drafting a baseline SOP from existing meeting notes
items.explanation: AI is excellent for drafting documentation based on data, while human tasks require empathy and judgment.

items.prompt: Exercise 55: AI Ethics. When using AI to summarize a meeting, an administrator should:
options: Send the summary to all stakeholders without checking it
Review and verify the AI-generated text for accuracy and tone
Tell everyone that a human wrote it
items.explanation: Human oversight is essential to ensure AI output is accurate and professional.

items.prompt: Exercise 56: AI Prompting. Write a prompt to ask an AI to summarize a 30-minute meeting about budget cuts into 5 key action points.
items.modelAnswer: Summarize the attached transcript of our budget meeting into five clear, actionable points for the finance committee.

items.prompt: Exercise 57: Peer Review. What is the primary focus of a peer review for a project proposal?
options: To criticize the author's personal style
To ensure the proposal is robust, clear, and persuasive before final submission
To rewrite the entire project from scratch
To check if the author used the right font color
items.explanation: Peer review is a collaborative process to improve the quality of the deliverable.

items.prompt: Exercise 58: Feedback Loops. 'Closing the loop' in feedback means:
options: Acknowledging the feedback but not making changes
Incorporating relevant feedback and informing the reviewer of the updates
Arguing with the reviewer about every point
items.explanation: Closing the loop involves using feedback to improve the output and communicating that progress.

items.prompt: Exercise 59: Giving Feedback. Provide a professional critique of this sentence from a proposal: 'The system is bad and we need a new one.'
items.modelAnswer: This sentence is too informal. It would be better to say: 'The current system is inefficient, creating a bottleneck that hinders our productivity.'

items.prompt: Exercise 60: Grammar Synthesis. Which sentence uses the Future Perfect correctly to describe a project milestone?
options: By next Tuesday, we will be finishing the audit.
By next Tuesday, we will have finished the audit.
By next Tuesday, we finish the audit.
By next Tuesday, we will have finishing the audit.
items.explanation: Future Perfect (will have + past participle) is used for completions by a specific time.

items.prompt: Exercise 61: Grammar Synthesis. 'If we hadn't ignored the warning signs last month, we wouldn't be in this crisis now.' This is a:
items.explanation: This is a mixed conditional linking a past action (hadn't ignored) to a present result (wouldn't be).

items.prompt: Exercise 62: Modals of Deduction. You find an unsigned report on your desk. You know Sarah was working on it. Write a sentence using 'must have'.
items.modelAnswer: Sarah must have left this report on my desk before she went home.

items.prompt: Exercise 63: Relative Clauses. Choose the correct pronoun: 'The stakeholders, ___ were present at the meeting, approved the budget.'
items.explanation: 'Who' is used for people in a non-defining relative clause.

items.prompt: Exercise 64: Trimester Review. Define 'BCP' and explain its importance.
items.modelAnswer: BCP stands for Business Continuity Planning. It is important because it ensures that essential functions can continue during and after a disaster.

items.prompt: Exercise 65: Operational Review. What is 'Scope Creep'?
options: The movement of the project team to a new office
The uncontrolled expansion of project requirements
The process of hiring new project managers
A type of virus that affects project management software
items.explanation: Scope creep refers to requirements growing beyond the original plan.

items.prompt: Exercise 66: SOP Design. Write one step for an SOP on 'Handling Confidential Waste'. Use an imperative verb.
items.modelAnswer: Place all sensitive documents into the designated secure shredding bin immediately after use.

items.prompt: Exercise 67: Stakeholder Review. In the Mendelow Matrix, how should you manage stakeholders with 'High Power / Low Interest'?
items.explanation: High power / Low interest stakeholders should be kept satisfied to avoid them becoming obstacles.

items.prompt: Exercise 68: Risk Management. Create a 'Mitigation' strategy for the risk: 'Key team member falls ill during the project execution.'
items.modelAnswer: Cross-train at least two other team members on the key responsibilities of each role to ensure continuity.

items.prompt: Exercise 69: Conflict Resolution. Which 'soft skill' is most important when delivering a difficult project update to a stakeholder?
items.explanation: Empathy helps in understanding the stakeholder's perspective and building rapport during tough conversations.

items.prompt: Exercise 70: Financial Persuasion. You are proposing a $5,000 software upgrade. Write one sentence justifying the 'ROI'.
items.modelAnswer: This investment will yield a full return within six months by reducing administrative errors and accelerating our billing cycle.

items.prompt: Exercise 71: Project Closure. Which task is NOT part of the 'Closure' phase?
items.explanation: Defining the project scope happens during the 'Initiation' or 'Planning' phase.

items.prompt: Exercise 72: Future Continuous. Describe what your team will be doing during the 'Execution' phase of the new office layout project.
items.modelAnswer: During the execution phase, our team will be coordinating with the furniture vendors and overseeing the physical relocation of workstations.

items.prompt: Exercise 73: Grammar Review. 'The proposal, which I submitted yesterday, is still under review.' Is 'which I submitted yesterday' a defining or non-defining relative clause?
items.explanation: It is non-defining because it adds extra information and is set off by commas.

items.prompt: Exercise 74: Trimester Reflection. Write one sentence about how your 'Professional Persona' in English has changed since Week 1.
items.modelAnswer: I feel much more confident using technical administrative vocabulary and can now lead project meetings with greater grammatical precision.

items.title: Exercise 75: Final Synthesis - The Proposal Pitch
items.prompt: Final Task: Combine your skills. Write a 3-sentence pitch for an administrative project. Include: 1) A 'Hook' with a pain point, 2) A 'Solution' using the Future Perfect for a milestone, and 3) A 'Financial Justification' using a conditional.
items.modelAnswer: Did you know our current manual filing system causes a 15% delay in document retrieval? By next month, we will have digitized all active records to eliminate this bottleneck. If we implement this change now, we will see a significant ROI through reduced labor costs and improved operational resilience.
